questions.question: Ptolemy's Model of the solar system

choices.answer: was the first to use ellipses as the orbits of planets
placed the Sun in the center
placed the Earth in the center
is the most widely accepted today

questions.question: Ptolemy's Geocentric Model is no longer accepted because

choices.answer: it died along with Ptolemy
the church said that it was no longer correct
Tycho Brahe's bladder exploded and so did Ptolemy's model
Kepler showed that the Heliocentric model was more accurate

questions.question: Nicholas Copernicus

choices.answer: developed the Heliocentric model of the solar system
placed the Sun in the center of our solar system
was a polish mathematician
Answers A, B, and C are all correct

questions.question: Ptolemy and Copernicus were both incorrect by saying

choices.answer: the planets orbit in perfect circles
the planets revolve counterclockwise
the planets rotate counterclockwise
the sun and planets appear to rise in the east

questions.question: Which was NOT a contribution made to Astronomy by Galileo?

choices.answer: He discovered Jupiter's 4 largest moons
He discovered Saturn's rings
He discovered more stars
He invented the telescope

questions.question: Ptolemy's model was unable to explain which one of Galileo's discoveries?

choices.answer: mountains on the moon
various sizes of objects falling at the same rate
the phases of Venus
the telescope

questions.question: Retrograde motion occurs when

choices.answer: a planet moves backwards in its orbit
young people wear old peoples' cool clothes
white light is bent by the Earth's atmosphere
a planet closer to the sun passes one farther away

questions.question: Kepler's First Law of Planetary Motion describes a planet's orbit as

choices.answer: round
circular
elliptical
retrograde

questions.question: The place in a planet's orbit that is closest to the Sun is called the

choices.answer: ecliptic
equinox
aphelion
perihelion

questions.question: "Eccentricity" describes the "flatness" of the ellipse.  Which has a value closest to 1?

choices.answer: The image on the far left
The image in the center
The image on the far right

questions.question: Kepler's Second Law of Planetary Motion tells us that

choices.answer: planets orbit in an ellipse
planets speed up and slow down as they orbit
planets farther away from the Sun take longer to orbit
planets want to move in a straight line

questions.question: Kepler's Third Law of Planetary Motion tells us that

choices.answer: given a planets distance we can calculate its orbital period
planets farther from the Sun take longer to orbit
planets closer to the sun have a shorter orbital period
Answers A, B, and C are all correct

questions.question: Inertia says that a rocket moving through space with the engine turned off will

choices.answer: eventually come to a rest
keep moving in a straight line unless acted upon by a force
inevitably crash into a planet or star
orbit the closest object

questions.question: Which is NOT an example of Inertia?

choices.answer: Using your brakes to slow down your bike on a hill
your bike coming to rest at the bottom of the hill
carrying your backpack slows you down while riding your bike
flying over the handlebars after hitting the curb

questions.question: Newton's Second Law of Motion (Force) tells us that

choices.answer: doubling the force will quadruple the acceleration
a smaller mass is easier to push or pull
F = md
You can't fool me, Newton's Second Law is Action Reaction

questions.question: Newton's Third Law of Motion tells us that

choices.answer: returning a slap is a scientific reaction to getting hit 1st
the harder you push a mass the faster it goes
gravity always wins
Earth & Sun exert the same gravitational force on each other

questions.question: The diagram shown demonstrates that

choices.answer: decreasing the mass makes the gravitational force stronger
decreasing the distance between masses weakens the gravity
gravitational force is dependent on both mass and distances
Newton got hit in the head by an apple

questions.question: Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation says that if you double the distance between two objects

choices.answer: the gravitational force will double
the gravitational force will increase by a factor of 4
the gravitational force will decrease by half
the gravitational force will decrease by a factor of 4

questions.question: According to Universal Law of Gravitation, if you triple the masses of both attracting objects

choices.answer: the gravitational force is three times greater
the gravitational force is nine times greater
the gravitational force is three times smaller
Enough math already!!!

questions.question: Escape Velocity is the

choices.answer: speed required to overtake and pass an object
speed that keeps an object in orbit
the speed of light
the speed required to overcome the gravity of an object

questions.question: The speed at which a planet orbits the Sun is determined by

choices.answer: the masses and distances between the objects
the speed and direction of the planet
the revolution and the rotation of the objects
Wikipedia

questions.question: Which statement is True regarding mass and weight?  If you went to the moon

choices.answer: your mass and weight would change
Only your mass would change
Only your weight would change
Neither your mass nor your weight would change

questions.question: Newtons 3rd Law - the "reaction" is the rocket lifting off. What is the "action?"

choices.answer: engines pushing against the launch pad
hot gases shooting from the rocket
hot air beneath the rocket expanding
potential energy converted to kinetic energy

questions.question: If Ken Griffey Jr. used a 2 kg bat to hit a pitch coming in at 45 m/s/s (Nolan Ryan fastball)

choices.answer: he would be hitting it with a force of 22.5 Newtons
He would be hit the ball with a force of 90 Newtons
he would hit the ball with a force of 2 Newtons
No way Ken Griffey Jr. can hit a Nolan Ryan fastball

questions.question: The Solar System

choices.answer: includes the planets and other bodies orbiting the Sun
includes the Sun and the planets only
extends out to the Kuiper Belt
contains billions of stars

questions.question: We discussed 5 "general" reasons why we study the solar system-name one other than colonization

choices.answer: "To see what's out there."
Extra-Terrestrials
Making $$$ by finding new resources
To learn how the solar system formed - its history

questions.question: Which term is most closely associated with "revolving" - "revolution?"

choices.answer: spinning
orbiting
inclination
turning around

questions.question: What is the coolest thing you've seen on the Star Projector?

choices.answer: The Summer Triangle
Some of the constellations of the Zodiac - Scorpio Capricorn
The Big Dipper pointing toward Polaris (North Star)
Can't choose one - these are all way too cool!!!
